remarks: Define the transitive predecessors of a class ` X ` under a relationship ` R ` and a class ` A ` .  This class can be thought of as the "smallest" class containing all elements of ` A ` that are linked to ` X ` by a chain of ` R ` relationships (see ~ trpredtr and ~ trpredmintr ).  Definition based off of Lemma 4.2 of Don Monk's notes for Advanced Set Theory, which can be found at ~ http://euclid.colorado.edu/~~monkd/settheory (check The Internet Archive for it now as Prof.  Monk appears to have rewritten his website).  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 2-Feb-2011.)
